result.execSummary:
The defendant Sherry D Corotan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Defendant shall not have direct or indirect contact with MTA (dob 9-1-1938) nor with R.I.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling or treatment programs as directed by her supervising agent. 
Defendant shall provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.

timeConds.notes:
With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.  
Court authorizes transfer to any other jail convenient to defendant's employment or residence.

Disposition Form

Def in person & by Atty Wilfred P. de Junco.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson appeared for State. Joint recommendation presented with counsel free to argue condition time. State confirms victim rights compliance. Argument by counsel. Statements by defendant. Defendant sentenced.
Sentencing hearing on May 27, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Def in person & by Atty Wilfred P. de Junco.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  State agrees to read-in an uncharged offense from HPD incident 16-0213.  State recommends upon a plea to this case a Withheld sentence and 3 years probation; Costs of $268.00; DNA surcharge of $250.00 and sample; Restitution of $1,717.60 plus 10% surcharge-defendant stipulates to restitution amount; No contact with the victim-M.T.A., dob 9-1-38 or Robin I; Counsling and treatment per agent; 30 days condition with and free to argue condition time.  Counsel request sentencing be adjourned to make sure has all necessary information.  No contest plea entered.  Court accepts the No contest plea.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 27, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Arraignment on May 13, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
